subject: Re: Problem running single test of a test case
msgSnippet: ... It may also be done using the Navigator.  However, this is a problem with Eclipse 3.2.0 (I originally posted 3.2.1, but this was incorrect) and JUnit 4.1.
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "gabrielcooper" <gabriel.cooper@...>
wrote:
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Mike McAfee" <memcafee@> wrote:
> >
> >
> >
> > I am using Eclipse 3.2.1 and JUnit 4.1. I would like to run a
> single test
> > that exists in a test case. A co-worker of mine is using Eclipse
> 3.1.2 and
> > is able to successfully do this. Eclipse 3.2.1 acts and displays
> results as
> > though one test was run. However, console output reveals that all
> tests in
> > the TestCase class are being run.
>
>
> From what I can tell, the only way to run an individual test is to
> right-click on the test's name in the "Outline" view pane.
>


It may also be done using the Navigator. However, this is a problem
with Eclipse 3.2.0 (I originally posted 3.2.1, but this was
incorrect) and JUnit 4.1. David suggested running the test using
JUnit 3 and this provided a great work-around.

I have reported this to Eclipse and am awaiting a response.
